comment: An edge of a multigraph always connects two vertices. Analogue of ~ umgredgprv . This theorem does not hold for arbitrary pseudographs: if either ` M ` or ` N ` is a proper class, then ` { M , N } e. E ` could still hold ( ` { M , N } ` would be either ` { M } ` or ` { N } ` , see ~ prprc1 or ~ prprc2 , i.e. a loop), but ` M e. V ` or ` N e. V ` would not be true. (Contributed by AV, 27-Nov-2020.)
